chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Paranoid people feel like the eyes of other people like to stare at them when they walk down the street.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " head " to " ding " sound. " Staring " means looking straight. "Jade articles. "Mubu": "Stare, stare at, stare at Huo." For example, Yuan Zhen in the Tang Dynasty "Ten Chapters with Wine": "Hu Bu Ri, Cha Gao Gao travels day and night, Hu is the moon wheel destroys the missing star ğ¥‹ stare." Lao She "Camel Xiangzi" "'There are soldiers to the west?' The old man's eyes fixed on Xiangzi's army pants."

" Staring " also means to follow closely and not relax. For example, the 65th episode of Chen Shaohai's "A Dream of Red Mansions" in the Qing Dynasty: "Sister Bao ran back last time. I will never let go of this trouble." Sha Ting's "Passing through the Pass" 12: "The enemy may still be watching Come up!"
humanum_short_description_en: From " head " to " ding " sound. " Staring " means looking straight, and also means following closely and not relaxing.
